alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Liberty; Polk (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 9:30AM CST until January 27 at 7:31AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Menard Creek near Rye affecting Polk, Hardin and Liberty Counties. For the Menard Creek...including Rye...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menard Creek near Rye. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water escapes the main channel in the vicinity of the gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 20.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CST Friday was 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 05/15/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Menard Creek Rye 20.0 20.0 Fri 9 am CST 18.6 15.8 14.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening.late tonight at 330 AM CST.
